content:
BaseValidator Class

In this Article

Provides the core implementation for all validation controls derived from this class. As an abstract class, it cannot be instantiated. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("ErrorMessage")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.BaseValidatorDesigner))]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.DataBindingHandler("System.Web.UI.Design.TextDataBindingHandler, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DesignerAdapter(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.Adapters.DesignerValidatorAdapter))]
public abstract class BaseValidator : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl, System.Web.UI.IValidator

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • Control
  • MobileControl
  • System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl
  • BaseValidator

Remarks

The BaseValidator class inherits from the TextControl base class, and thus has a Text property. In the event of an invalid entry, the validator displays the value of the Text property. If the property is not set, the validator displays the value of the ErrorMessage property instead; this is the text that is shown in the ValidationSummary control. This behavior is consistent with Web Forms validators.

Of the ASP.NET mobile controls, those that support validation are the TextBox control (its Text property) and the SelectionList control (its SelectedIndex property). Other controls can participate in validation by including a ValidationPropertyAttribute attribute. For more information, see the How to: Validate Against a Specific Value for ASP.NET Server Controls documentation.

Constructors summary

BaseValidator()

Initializes a new instance of the BaseValidator class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

ControlToValidate

Gets or sets the ID of the control to validate. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Display

Gets or sets the display behavior of the error message of the validation control. The default value is ValidatorDisplay. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ErrorMessage

Gets or sets the text that will be used for the error message. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IsValid

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data validated by the control is valid. The default value is true. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
StyleReference

Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
VisibleWeight

Returns the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

CheckControlValidationProperty(String,String)

Determines whether the specified control to be validated has a property that can be validated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ControlPropertiesValid()

Determines whether the properties to be validated are valid. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
CreateStyle()

Constructs and returns the Style object to be associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
CreateWebValidator()

Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator. The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
EvaluateIsValid()

Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web Form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnInit(EventArgs)

Raises the Init event.
OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Raises the PreRender event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Validate()

Performs control validation, and then sets the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.IsValid* property based on the results of the validation. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • BaseValidator()

    Initializes a new instance of the BaseValidator class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected BaseValidator ();

    Remarks

    Although you cannot directly construct a BaseValidator class, you can call this constructor from the constructor of an inheriting class.

Properties

  • ControlToValidate

    Gets or sets the ID of the control to validate. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public string ControlToValidate { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The ID of the control to validate.

    Remarks

    Throws an exception during pre-rendering if the ID is empty or not valid.

  • Display

    Gets or sets the display behavior of the error message of the validation control. The default value is ValidatorDisplay. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatorDisplay Display { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ValidatorDisplay

      The display behavior of the error message of the validation control.

    Remarks

    The Display property supports only the ValidatorDisplay value.

    The .NET Framework Web Forms ValidatorDisplay enumeration represents the different display behaviors of the error messages in validation controls.

  • ErrorMessage

    Gets or sets the text that will be used for the error message. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public string ErrorMessage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The text that will be used for the error message.

    Remarks

    This property is used in two ways. First, if there is no value for the Display property, the value of the ErrorMessage property is used in its place. Second, when the ValidationSummary control is used, the summary uses the value of the ErrorMessage property for each validator that represents an invalid control.

  • IsValid

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data validated by the control is valid. The default value is true. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public bool IsValid { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data validated by the control is valid; otherwise, false.

  • StyleReference

    Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override string StyleReference { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      None.

  • VisibleWeight

    Returns the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override int VisibleWeight { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      None.

Methods

  • CheckControlValidationProperty(String,String)

    Determines whether the specified control to be validated has a property that can be validated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected void CheckControlValidationProperty (string name, string propertyName);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the control that has a property to be validated.

    • propertyName
      String

      The name of the property that is to be validated.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      either the name or propertyName parameters is null.

  • ControlPropertiesValid()

    Determines whether the properties to be validated are valid. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual bool ControlPropertiesValid ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if control properties to be validated are valid; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ControlToValidate* property is empty or the control does not exist.

  • CreateStyle()

    Constructs and returns the Style object to be associated with the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style CreateStyle ();

    Returns

    • Style

      A new Style object.

  • CreateWebValidator()

    Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator. The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseValidator CreateWebValidator ();

    Returns

    • BaseValidator

      An aggregated Web validator.

    Remarks

    Creates and returns the corresponding Web Controls validator object. The default implementation of this method in a BaseValidator object returns null.

  • EvaluateIsValid()

    Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web Form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected abstract bool EvaluateIsValid ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the validator is valid, otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    You can override this method with a derived method to provide your own validation logic when implementing your own validator controls.

  • OnInit(EventArgs)

    Raises the Init event.

    protected override void OnInit (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      None

  • OnPreRender(EventArgs)

    Raises the PreRender event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      None

  • Validate()

    Performs control validation, and then sets the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.IsValid* property based on the results of the validation. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public void Validate ();

    Remarks

    The Validate method causes the IsValid property of the control to be set to true or false, depending on the outcome of the validation test.
